API Reference (Autodoc)

This section is automatically generated by Sphinx Autodoc, pulling information directly from the Python docstrings. This documentation details the inputs, outputs, and logging behavior of the main application views (functions).

Note

All documented views utilize the Python logging module to track operations and errors (INFO/DEBUG/ERROR levels), facilitating debugging and ensuring critical exceptions are captured by Sentry.

Lettings Application Views (lettings.views)

View functions for the ‘lettings’ application, handling the listing and detail pages for rental properties.

lettings.views.index(request)[source]

Renders the index page for all lettings.

Retrieves all Letting objects from the database and passes them to the template.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Context:

lettings_list (QuerySet): A list of all available Letting objects.

lettings.views.letting(request, letting_id)[source]

Renders the detail page for a specific letting.

Retrieves a single Letting object based on its ID. Returns a 404 error if not found.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • letting_id (int) – The primary key (ID) of the Letting to retrieve.

Context:

title (str): The title of the letting. address (Address): The associated Address object for the letting.

Profiles Application Views (profiles.views)

View functions for the ‘profiles’ application, handling the listing and detail pages for user profiles.

profiles.views.index(request)[source]

Renders the index page for all user profiles.

Retrieves all Profile objects from the database and passes them to the template.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Context:

profiles_list (QuerySet): A list of all available Profile objects.

profiles.views.profile(request, username)[source]

Renders the detail page for a specific user profile.

Retrieves a single Profile object based on the username. Returns a 404 error if not found.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • username (str) – The username associated with the Profile to retrieve.

Context:

profile (Profile): The retrieved Profile object.

Root Application Views (oc_lettings_site.views)

Root view functions for the main project site, including the homepage and custom handlers for 404 and 500 errors.

oc_lettings_site.views.index(request)[source]

Renders the main index (homepage) of the application.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

oc_lettings_site.views.custom_404_view(request, exception)[source]

Renders the custom 404 (Page Not Found) error page.

This function is used by the Django handler404. It ensures the response returns an HTTP 404 status code.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

  • exception – The exception object passed by Django (required signature).

oc_lettings_site.views.custom_500_view(request)[source]

Renders the custom 500 (Internal Server Error) page.

This function is used by the Django handler500. It ensures the response returns an HTTP 500 status code.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.
